title: What music does everyone listen to whilst playing?
body:
It's commonly known that people listen to music while playing, What genres / artists do you guys all listen to?

I just throw on my playlist from spotify with all of my fave songs tbh :) [here](https://play.spotify.com/collection/jumpzehh/77vNguStkWNu8uHl0RoM51)

replies.body: i got a wide range in pandora from opera to death metal and all inbetween just no pop
I used to use pandora for variety, I found spotify was better (On demand music and radio if you wanted - For cheap too)

Disturbed, A7X, Malmsteen, Steve Vai, anime OST...
very random, but mostly songs with mad guitar solo

My music is all over the place. I have a lot of rock, classical, jazz, nightcore, EDM, some metal, pop, hip hop, etc. Recently I've tried listening to a playlist full of upbeat, exciting music to see if that helps my play but I don't think it is.

Usually nothing.

Unless i'm playing Olaf. Then i listen to Pirate/Viking Metal.

I play the bronze theme tune 
https://youtu.be/npx2NK3Utrw
I listen to everything, always, and I do too in League, only, I find I can't concentrate as well with music sometimes, so most of the time, I don't have anything playing
Mainly Jazz and funk. I can't stand that heavy metal shit they call music... I'd rather pop, and that is saying something...

Okay you may not like heavy metal, but that doesn't mean its not music. It took talented people to create it. Unlike techno and electronic where anyone can just make songs by tapping some buttons hoping it would make something.

I'm not saying it's not music, I'm saying comparing it to the greats (Miles Davis, Louis Armstrong, John Coltrane etc...), it's just not as impacting in the music industry. Hey, I'm not hating heavy metal listeners, I'm just not a fan, my opinion.
https://youtu.be/4gBEznBdFxM
Heavy metal isn't for everyone man, I used to hate it tbh, I listen to it on occasion, But my main genre is indie rock or electro/trap/glitch hop/dubstep/Drum and bass
Mostly hip-hop. Dumbfoundead, Nas, Cage, Vince Staples, and a little bit of Nujabes.
I love nas..

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j0mnRkIl3ec

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bju_GnvcyCE

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GzOorXe8Cm0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j7EApky3bUY

Then once I'm sick of looping these songs switch to one of my dubstep mixes then usually jump to:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Waqn0jBG58

and

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=McsoqmJJ3eg

Then usually just resort to Resident evil sound track then shuffle and skip through my tunes or jump back and forth between songs I like in my mainly dubstep playlist. Got 2 much music, but always have room for more. I usually favouritize a few songs then switch to a few different favourites and spam them a lot.
Glitch Hop, electro (mostly monstercatmedia)
Oh man, I love Rameses B and pretty much anyone on going quantum and monstercat!
I like tristam the best :D
and braken :) - when those 2 combine, they are an unstoppable force.
Dynasty Warriors 3 Soundtrack
Good choice comrade..
whatever's in my shitty playlist
Care to elaborate? :)
Breaking Benjamin and Trap music stuff.
I used to listen to breaking benjamin all throughout high school! It's good stuff, I used to listen to bullet for my valentine heaps too during that phase..
igorrr
the gears of the autism factory churning.
